title: 111_hr6510
content: The Administrator of General Services in Houston, Texas will convey real property to the Military Museum of Texas at market value determined by an independent appraisal. The property is described as 3.673 acres of land in Lot 3 of Moers Subdivision in Harris County, Texas. The conveyance of real property in Harris County, Texas includes a detailed survey description with specific coordinates and boundaries. The property is to be transferred to the Military Museum of Texas at market value determined by an independent appraisal. The conveyance of real property in Harris County, Texas to the Military Museum of Texas includes structures, improvements, and fixtures. The Museum must use and maintain the property for at least 30 years. Failure to do so may result in the property reverting to the United States. The Museum has the option to seek abrogation of the use restriction. The Military Museum of Texas can seek abrogation of the use restriction by obtaining written consent from the Administrator and paying the fair market value of the property. The fair market value will be determined by an independent appraisal commissioned by the Administrator and paid for by the Museum. Additionally, the Museum must submit reports to the Administrator annually after the conveyance of the property. The Military Museum of Texas must submit annual reports on the use and maintenance of the conveyed property for 30 years. Inspections will be conducted by the Administrator every 5 years to confirm the information provided in the reports. The Administrator may impose additional terms and conditions to protect the interests of the United States. The Military Museum of Texas is responsible for all costs related to the conveyance, including real estate and environmental documentation. This section does not affect compliance with environmental laws. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
